while migrating some of r-kafka code, I had the following in mind:
what if r-core adds more "negative" Emission cases but I only handle one.
Hence the idea:
Add Emission#isSuccessful, so that it can be checked in places like this one.
WDYT?

replies.bodyText: there's hasEmitted() and hasFailed(). Maybe I should rename hasEmitted() to hasSucceeded()? not sure what you mean by "checked in places like this one" though... are you suggesting this piece of code should check something more?

replies.bodyText:
Ah, cool, so we can use hasEmitted() here (although renaming it to hasSucceeded() would be nice).
BTW isn't hasFailed() == !hasEmitted()? Why both?
re "can be checked in places like this one":
sorry, I meant this method is a good example where such boolean could be handy, and there are more methods like this one (in this PR but also in r-kafka, for example), hence "the flag that can be checked in places like this one"

yeah, I think it was just added because it reads better. And most likely, hasFailed() is going to be the more interesting one to check...
I've opened a separate issue to track these

timeline.message:
[Polish] Add inners[] param to Operators dropMulticast private methods

Reviewed-in: #2327

fix #2319 Split emitXxx/tryEmitXxx, more consistent use of hooks

tryEmit methods should mostly not use onErrorDropped/onNextDropped or
onDiscard hooks, leaving that to the emit methods (or to the user).

most usage of sinks in tests relies on `emit` methods, which is pretty
consistent with their new semantic of "doing the right thing" out of the
box (since most test usage didn't even check the Emission result).

Reviewed-in: #2327

[polish] Avoid potential infinite busy looping in tests

Reviewed-in: #2327

fix #2329 Improve Emission API: polish status helpers, add orThrow()

 - `hasEmitted` is a bit confusing ("Emission has emitted") so it has
 been renamed to `hasSucceeded()`
 - `hasOverflowed()`, `wasPreviouslyCancelled()` and
 `wasPreviouslyTerminate()` don't bring much value compared to direct
 equal checks, even in terms of readability (contrary to `hasFailed()`
 so these 3 methods have been removed

On top of that, a new `orThrow()` method is added to `Emission` to
easily turn a failure enum into throwing an exception (if absolutely
needed and relevant).
